textAfterTable: 2007-07-07 : Wladimir Klitschko 243½ lbs beat Lamon Brewster 228¼ lbs by RTD at 3:00 in round 6 of 12 Location: Kolnarena, Cologne, Nordrhein-Westfalen, Germany Referee: Sam Williams Judge: Michael Fischer 60-54 Judge: Dennis Nelson 60-54 Judge: Alfred Buqwana 60-54 International Boxing Federation Heavyweight Title (3rd defence of Klitschko) International Boxing Organization Heavyweight Title (3rd defence of Klitschko) Time: 3:00 Weights: Klitschko 243.5 lbs, Brewster 228.25 lbs Announcer: Michael Buffer Comments Klitschko dominated the fight using his strong left jab, which he followed up with strong rights to the head. Klitschko broke his left middle finger in the first round. Brewster's trainer, James (Buddy) McGirt, asked the referee to stop the fight after the sixth round. Mandatory defense for Klitschko, due to Brewster being the highest available contender in the IBF rankings. Brewster entered the bout having not fought in 15 months as he recovered from a detached retina suffered in his previous bout against Siarhei Liakhovich.
